item.title: Former Subnautica 2 Director Says The Game Is "Ready" For Early Access Release
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

In 2021, PUBG publisher Krafton purchased Unknown Worlds, the studio behind the critically acclaimed Subnautica. The sequel, Subnautica 2, began development roughly a year later. But last week, Subnautica director and designer Charlie Cleveland and his fellow Unknown Worlds co-founder Max McGuire were reportedly forced out the company alongside CEO Ted Gill. Now, Cleveland has shared a message for fans about his ouster and where Subnautica 2 currently stands.

In an extended post on Reddit, Cleveland wrote "the events of this week have been quite a shock" in addition to recapping the history of Unknown Worlds, which began with a Half-Life mod called Natural Selection. Krafton's announcement of Cleveland's departure suggested that Subnautica 2 isn't ready for early access, an assertion that the director denies.

"We know that the game is ready for early access release and we know you're ready to play it," said Cleveland. "And while we thought this was going to be our decision to make, at least for now, that decision is in Krafton’s hands. And after all these years, to find that I'm no longer able to work at the company I started stings."

"Our priority is, and has always been, to make the best damned game we can for the best community in the world," added Cleveland. "With your Gorge plushies and your hand-drawn fish fan-art, and yes, your hard-earned dollars, you've supported us in every way, in every season, cold and warm, since Half-Life modding was even a thing. And I also want you to know that this is not where the story ends."

As reported by PC Gamer, some fans have called for a Subnautica 2 boycott and urged others to remove the game from their wish lists. That led to a response from Unknown Worlds which asks players for patience and notes that most of Subnautica 2's developers remain with the project.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/former-subnautica-2-director-says-the-game-is-ready-for-early-access-release/1100-6533016/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: These Two '90s Gaming Icons Are Coming To World Of Tanks
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

World of Tanks is getting some surprising guest stars with the next Battle Pass Special. Duke Nukem and Tomb Raider's Lara Croft will be getting their own personalized tanks as they headline two separate Heroes' Paths chapters from July 10 to July 21. According the launch trailer below, Lara's chapter will have 30 stages while Duke's will have 40.

Keeley Hawes is reprising her role as Lara Croft from a handful of Tomb Raider games that were released before the 2013 reboot, as well as Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light. Although Lara isn't known for using a tank, her vehicle of choice in this game is a Tier VIII U.S. versatile medium tank that comes with a lot of Lara's archeology tools including her hatchet, ropes, cables, a winch, and more.

Jon St. John--the original and only voice of Duke Nukem--is also stepping back into his iconic role for this guest appearance. Unlike Lara, Duke riding in a tank feels very much in character. His ride is a nuclear-powered TS-6, a Tier IX U.S. assault heavy tank. Understandably, it comes with a lot of Duke's heavy ordinance including laser machine guns, grenade launchers, and other "enhanced weapons systems."

Duke and Lara's stages will include several nods to their respective histories with returning characters, cosmetics, and collectibles. A new Lara Croft theme was created for this event, while Duke Nukem's Grabbag theme will be used in his portion of the game.

Earlier this summer, Lesta Games--the Russian studio behind Mir Tankov, an offshoot of World of Tanks--was accused by Russia of illegally funneling money from its title to Ukraine. Wargaming--the studio behind World of Tanks--hasn't hidden its support for Ukraine in the war against Russia. However, Wargaming and Lesta Games are no longer tied together, despite the allegations.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/these-two-90s-gaming-icons-are-coming-to-world-of-tanks/1100-6533014/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Amazon Prime Members Get 4 More Free Games For Prime Day, Including Star Wars And Marvel Titles
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon is sweetening the pot for Prime members ahead of Prime Day on July 8, offering four free bonus games members will be able to claim free of charge.

As usual, the free games claimed are yours to keep, even if your Amazon Prime subscription lapses. This batch of games includes titles from two of the biggest IPs in the world, Star Wars and Marvel, a critically acclaimed horror game, and the latest installment in an ever-popular sports management series. The four games will be free starting July 8, and will be available for redemption through GOG (in the case of the Star Wars game) or the Epic Games Store.

Prime Gaming Free Prime Day Bonus Games Starting July 8

  • Star Wars Jedi Knight: Dark Forces II (GOG)
  • Amnesia: The Dark Descent (Epic Games Store)
  • Marvel's Midnight Suns (Epic Games Store)
  • Football Manager 2024 (Epic Games Store)

It is worth nothing that Football Manager 2024 will be available only during the Prime Day period, which ends on Friday, July 11 at 11:59 p.m. PST, so make sure to claim it by then.

Overall, it's not a bad selection of titles. While Dark Forces II is definitely the least appreciated of the Dark Forces/Jedi Knight series, it's still an enjoyable, old-school FPS romp. Meanwhile, Amnesia: The Dark Descent is one of the best horror games of the last two decades (it sports an 85 on Metacritic). Midnight Suns didn't meet sale expectations when it released in 2022, but it's still worth playing for fans of the tactics genre and comes from the creators of the legendary XCOM series. Football Manager is also a great get, as Football Manager 2025 was recently canceled, making this the latest game in the series until it presumably returns sometime next year.

These four games aren't the only freebies Prime members can claim in July. Amazon previously announced seven other free games, though many of them are probably ones you haven't heard of before. The full list is below.

Now available

  • Boxes: Lost Fragments (Epic Games Store)
  • Paquerette Down the Bunburrows (Epic Games Store)

July 17

  • Endless Space 2: Definitive Edition (Amazon Games App)
  • Besiege: The Splintered Sea (Amazon Games App)

July 24

  • Venba
  • I Love Finding Wild Friends Collector's Edition (Legacy games code)

July 31

  • Heroes of Loot (GOG)

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/amazon-prime-members-get-4-more-free-games-for-prime-day-including-star-wars-and-marvel-titles/1100-6533009/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Gets First Big Discount For Prime Day
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Assassin’s Creed Shadows is one of the biggest releases of 2025 so far, earning positive reviews and selling over 3 million copies since arriving in March. If you’ve yet to check out the latest epic from Ubisoft, Assassin’s Creed: Shadows is getting its first big discount for Prime Day, and you can pick up the Amazon-exclusive Assassin’s Creed Shadows: Limited Edition for $47.50 (normally $70). That’s the best price we’ve ever seen for the game, which has rarely dipped below $70. This Amazon-exclusive version includes the Sekiryu Character Pack, offering legendary gear and weapons, plus a mount and trinket. Prime Day runs from July 8-11, so you only have a few days to pick this deal up--assuming it doesn't sell out before then. The deal applies to the PS5 and Xbox versions.

Our Assassin’s Creed Shadows review gave it an 8/10, praising Naoe’s fluid movement system and engaging stealth gameplay. The world is also an absolute blast to explore, thanks to changing seasons and plenty of dramatic vistas.

“Naoe's gameplay is the best that the series has felt since the transition to a more action-RPG format--Assassin's Creed Shadows is an absolute blast to play,” wrote critic Jordan Ramée. “Shadows feels like a world that Ubisoft Quebec has made its own…Shadows keeps its open fields and winding roads interesting with picturesque views, amusing conversations from the odd passerby, and a world that feels more alive than Origins' Egypt or Odyssey's Greece, because it changes and evolves with the seasons.”

Assassin’s Creed Books

Looking to dive deeper into the expansive world of Assassin’s Creed? A bunch of art books and guidebooks are on sale right now. The Assassin’s Creed Shadows Strategy Guide makes a great companion for the game, offering insight into its many secrets and showing you how to complete all its quests. There’s also a gorgeous Collector’s Edition with a premium hardcover design. Alternatively, you can pick up The Art of Assassin’s Creed Shadows--available in two formats, you’ll find the Deluxe Edition bundled with a slipcase and gallery-caliber prints. After checking out the Assassin's creed book deals, be sure to check our Prime Day hub to see the latest discounts on video games, electronics, Blu-rays, and more.

  • The Art of Assassin’s Creed Shadows (Hardcover) -- $30 ($50)
  • The Art of Assassin’s Creed Shadows: Deluxe Edition (Hardcover) -- $72.83 ($100)
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows Official Guide (Paperback) -- $22.68 ($30)
  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows Official Guide: Collector's Edition (Hardcover) -- $36.19 ($45)

item.title: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Headsets Are Discounted During Prime Day 2025
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon’s Prime Day is back, and this year it's running from July 8-11, giving you four days to grab the thousands of deals. This year, the price cuts include multiple SteelSeries Arctis headsets, many of which are $50 off during the sale. The best price cut is for the premium SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless headset, which is down to $323 (was $380). Additionally, the Arctis Nova 5 and Arctis Nova 7 are also on sale. These are some of our favorite gaming headsets, so we recommend grabbing them while they're discounted--and since there are multiple models of each headset with support for PS5, Xbox Series X, Switch, or PC, chances are you'll find one that suits your setup.

SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5

$105 (was $150)

The SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5 offers up to 60 hours of battery life, a companion app that lets you customize its performance, a retractable microphone, and 40mm audio drivers. The headset supports Bluetooth and wired USB-C connections. Multiple models are available, each offering different platform support. The standard Arctis Nova 5 and Nova 5P both support wireless connections to PC, PlayStation, Switch, and mobile. The 5X, however, supports wireless connections on Xbox, PC, PlayStation, PC, and mobile. That makes the Nova 5X the one to get if you’re worried about cross-platform support, as it’s compatible with the most devices.

  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5 Wireless (PC, PS5, PS4, Switch, Mobile) -- $105 ($150)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5P Wireless (PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $105 ($150)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 5X Wireless (Xbox, PC, PS5, PS4, Switch, Mobile) -- $105 ($150)

SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7

$150 (was $200)

The Arctis Nova 7 lineup is also discounted during Prime Day, and it's a marked step up in quality from the Arctis 5, holding the title as our current overall favorite gaming headset on all platforms. It offers a steel headband with the Arctis Nova's characteristic suspension padding, four points of adjustment, rotating earcups, and memory foam earcup cushions. Battery life is a bit worse at 38 hours, but you’re trading battery life for better audio, support for simultaneous game and mobile audio, and a headset that just feels a cut above its cheaper sibling. Like the Nova 5, the Nova 7 comes in multiple variants with different platform support; the &X is the only one that supports Xbox consoles.

  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7P Wireless - Black (PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $150 ($200)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7P Wireless - White (PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $150 ($200)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7X Wireless - Black (Xbox, PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $150 ($200)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova 7X Wireless - White (Xbox, PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $150 ($200)

SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless

$323 (was $380)

Finally, there's the SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro, which is our pick for the Best Premium Wireless Gaming Headset, and that’s even more true when it’s just $323. Offering excellent noise cancellation, support for Tempest 3D Audio and Microsoft Spatial Audio, a retractable microphone, and ultra-plush earcups, it’s a well-rounded companion for all types of games.

Unlike the built-in rechargeable batteries of the Nova 5 and 7 lines, the Nova Pro Wireless uses hot-swappable batteries. So long as you always have one of its two included batteries charging, you can continuously swap them out for unlimited wireless use. The headset connects to your devices via Bluetooth or the included 2.4GHz USB base station. The Base station also sports an OLED screen that lets you quickly toggle its settings like EQ, noise cancellation, mic side tone, and more. Once again, three versions are available, each with separate device support.

  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless - White (PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $323 ($380)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless - Black (PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $323 ($380)
  • SteelSeries Arctis Nova Pro Wireless (Xbox) - White (Xbox, PS5, PS4, PC, Switch, Mobile) -- $323 ($380)

item.title: Space Marine 2 Gets A 50% Discount For Prime Day 2025
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 was one of 2024's best games, returning players to Warhammer's grimdark galaxy of endless warfare and continuing the story of the first game nearly a decade later. If you haven't played it yet, now is the time to give it a go, as , you can pick up Space Marine 2 for PS5 and Xbox Series X for just $35 during Amazon's Prime Day 2025 sale this week, bringing it down to its lowest price since launch. But act quickly, as this 50% discount will only be available until Prime Day ends on July 11.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

$35 (was $70)

Based on the popular tabletop franchise, Space Marine 2 continues the story of Demetrian Titus, following his self-imposed exile after the events of the first game. What makes Space Marine 2 a standout title is uncomplicated action, as you'll be able to blast and smash your way through enemies using a rich arsenal of weapons and satisfying brutality.

The game also features incredible environments for you to explore, and since launch, it has received several free updates that have added new modes and challenges to the game.

Our Space Marine 2 review gave it an impressive 8/10 score, calling it a "more-than-worthy successor to the 2011 original" that action game fans will appreciate.

You can also pair this purchase with several Warhammer 40,000 books that go deep into the lore and art of the franchise. The Art of Warhammer Video Games will be out on November 4, and it's a luxurious look at the artwork from 30 years of Warhammer games.

Another book to keep an eye out for is the Warhammer 40,000: Character Encyclopedia, which is available to preorder ahead of its October 7 release date for $26. This 200-page tome provides in-depth information on over 120 characters, accompanied by detailed photographs of Games Workshop miniatures.

For something more immediate, there's also the Warhammer 40,000: Ultimate Guide, a 336-page hardcover volume that explores the lore behind several characters and has hundreds of photos highlighting their miniature figures from the tabletop game.

Warhammer 40,000 books on sale

  • Warhammer 40,000: Ultimate Guide -- $25.32 ($45)
  • Warhammer 40,000: Words of War -- $13 | Releases October 7
  • Warhammer 40,000: Character Encyclopedia -- $26 ($28) | Releases October 7
  • The Art of Warhammer Video Games -- $50 | Releases November 4

Space Marine 2 is just one of many video game deals available in Amazon's Prime Day 2025 sale. Other notable discounts include Final Fantasy VII Rebirth, Final Fantasy XVI, and WWE 2K25, to name a few. You'll find even more deals on games, books, Blu-rays, and other categories on GameSpot's Prime Day deals hub.

More Prime Day Gaming Deals

item.title: Prime Day 2025 - Save $50 On The Sega Astro City Mini Arcade Cabinet
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Owning an arcade would be cool, if you had the space for all of those coin-munching machines. Fortunately, you can save some space--and cash--with this Prime Day special on the adorable Sega Astro City Mini arcade gaming device, which is on sale for its lowest price ever. Normally $130, you can pick this up for just $80 and enjoy the dozens of games loaded onto it.

Sega Astro City Mini

$80 (was $130)

The Sega Astro City Mini is a 1:6 scale replica of the original arcade cabinet featuring 37 pre-installed Sega games, including all-time classics like Puyo Puyo, Golden Axe, and Virtua Fighter. The full list of games is outlined below.

The device is equipped with a 480 x 800 LCD screen, an HDMI-out port so you can connect it to a TV, two USB-A ports, and a headphone jack. While it's much smaller than the original machine, the Sega Astro City Mini's joystick and buttons are big enough to make playing games on it feel natural--and if you're looking to have some multiplayer sessions with it, there is an official controller that you can pick up as a separate purchase.

Sega Astro City Mini Pre-installed games:

  • Alex Kidd: The Lost Stars
  • Alien Storm
  • Alien Syndrome
  • Altered Beast
  • Arabian Fight
  • Bonanza Bros.
  • Columns
  • Columns 2
  • Cotton
  • Crack Down
  • Cyber Police ESWAT
  • Dark Edge
  • Dottori Kun (Dot Race)
  • Fantasy Zone
  • Flicky
  • Gain Ground
  • Golden Axe
  • Golden Axe: Revenge of Death Adder
  • My Hero
  • Puyo Puyo
  • Puyo Puyo 2
  • Puzzle & Action: Ichidant-R
  • Puzzle & Action: Tant-R
  • Rad Mobile
  • Quartet 2
  • Scramble Spirits
  • Sega Ninja
  • Shadow Dancer
  • Shinobi
  • Sonic Boom
  • Space Harrier
  • Stack Columns
  • Thunder Force AC
  • Virtua Fighter
  • Wonder Boy
  • Wonder Boy in Monster Land
  • Wonder Boy 3: Monster Lair

Arcade fans can also check out this Neo Geo machine

If you're looking to assemble a collection of tiny arcades, there are some nice options to choose from in this department. The Unico MVS Mini is another fun machine, and at $70, it's actually cheaper than the Sega Astro City Mini. This one comes with 45 games in total, including multiple games from the King of Fighters, Samurai Shodown, and Metal Slug franchises.

It's basically a tribute to the Neo Geo era of arcade gaming, and it's equipped with a vibrant 3.5-inch LCD screen, stereo speakers, and an HDMI port so that you can also plug it into your TV. If you're on the move, it's powered via a USB-C cable so you can easily connect it to a PC or a portable power supply to have some mobile fun.

If you're looking for more retro gaming deals, several remastered collections of classic games are also available during Prime Day, including Suikoden I & II HD Remastered (Switch, PS5, Xbox Series X), Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection (Switch, PS5), Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection, and the Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol. 1.

More Prime Day Gaming Deals

  • Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection (Switch) -- $30 ($40)
  • Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection (PS5) -- $20 ($40)
  • Metal Gear Solid: Master Collection Vol.1 (Switch) -- $20 ($40)
  • Suikoden I & II HD Remastered (Switch) -- $30 ($50)

  • Suikoden I & II HD Remastered (Xbox Series X) -- $30 ($50)
  • Yu-Gi-Oh! Early Days Collection (Switch) -- $35 ($50)

That's just a small selection of video game deals available in Amazon's Prime Day Sale, which runs from July 8-11 this year. Be sure to check GameSpot's Prime Day 2025 Deals Hub for the latest discounts on games, electronics, collectibles, and more.

item.title: Prime Day 2025 - Razer V2 Pro Wireless Headset Deals
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Prime Day has kicked off, and if you're looking to retire your current headset for something newer, then look no further than this deal on the Razer Blackshark V2 Pro. Normally $200, this wireless headset has been discounted to $150, and that's a great price for a model that offers a very strong battery life, good looks, and can be used on both multiple devices. Prime Day 2025 runs from July 8-11, but there's always a chance these deals could run out before then, so be sure to grab the discounted headset while you can.

Razer Blackshark V2 Pro Wireless Headset

$150 (was $200)

This premium headset features a comfy design with noise-isolating earcups sporting soft memory foam cushioning and breathable fabric. As for the audio, it uses a bass-heavy profile that's tuned for gaming, so expect punchy sound effects. No wonder it's popular with Fortnite pros. It also includes a detachable unidirectional boom mic. The battery life is also worth shouting out, as a full charge will get you up to 70 hours of use, which puts it on the higher end of wireless headset batteries.

Note that there are two versions of this headset available, and each one supports 2.4GHz wireless connections on different devices. The Xbox version works with Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PS5, PS4, PC, and mobile, and supports Windows spatial audio. The PlayStation version works with PS5, PS4, PC, and mobile, and it's also compatible with Sony's Tempest spatial audio tech. Both models are eligible for the discount.

Don't mind wires? Check out the Razer Blackshark V2 X

If $150 is a little too rich for your blood, or you're more into wired connections than wireless ones, you can also check out the deals on the wired Razer Blackshark V2 X headset. These have similar specs to the wireless V2 Pro--including similar platform-specific spatial audio support--but use a wired 3.5mm connection. The good news is that thanks to the audio jack, these will work on anything with a 3.5mm connection, like PC, Xbox, PlayStation, and both Nintendo Switch consoles.

PS5

  • Razer BlackShark V2 X PlayStation Gaming Headset (pink) -- $40 ($50)
  • Razer BlackShark V2 X PlayStation Gaming Headset (black) -- $40 ($50)
  • Razer BlackShark V2 X PlayStation Gaming Headset (white) -- $40 ($50)

Xbox Series X|S

  • Razer BlackShark V2 X Xbox Gaming Headset (white) -- $40 ($50)
  • Razer BlackShark V2 X Xbox Gaming Headset (pink) -- $40 ($50)
  • Razer BlackShark V2 X Xbox Gaming Headset (black) -- $40 ($50)

Plenty of other Razer devices are part of Amazon's Prime Day 2025 sale, which runs until July 11. This includes the Razer Kishi Ultra mobile controller for $100 (was $150), Xbox and PS5 controller charging stations, and more. We've listed all the Razer Prime Day 2025 deals below, or you can head over to GameSpot's Prime Day 2025 deals hub to see the latest discounts from other brands and categories.

item.title: Prime Day 2025 - Grab Elden Ring And Shadow Of The Erdtree For Cheap
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon's Prime Day sale is now live, and this year's deals include big discounts on some excellent video games, including From Software's epic action RPG, Elden Ring. PS5 and Xbox Series X versions of Elden Ring are on sale for just $40 (was $60), while the PS4 version is even cheaper at $30 (was $40). Meanwhile, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Edition is just $60 (was $80), and it’s arguably the best option of the bunch. The expansion typically costs $40--and since it requires the base game, getting both for just $60 is a steal. In fact, this is the lowest price we’ve seen for the bundle since Black Friday, and it’s unlikely to go lower until the big shopping holiday rolls around again.

Elden Ring is one of the biggest and most widely acclaimed games of the last few years. When it released in February 2022, Elden Ring earned an impeccable 10/10 in our Elden Ring review, and it would eventually go on to win numerous Game of the Year Awards, including GameSpot’s. The brutally difficult adventure continued in 2024 with the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. Much like the base game, the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion earned a remarkable 10/10 in our review, with reviewer Tamoor Hussain saying, "With all that Shadow of the Erdtree offers to accompany what exists in the Lands Between, the story of Elden Ring now feels complete and its world whole, and it's a staggering achievement."

If you’re looking for other ways to explore the rich, dark fantasy world of Elden Ring, there are also Prime Day deals on the official Elden Ring strategy guides, manga, and board games. Check the lists below for some of our favorites. Beyond Elden Ring, Amazon's sale also features big discounts on video games, books, Blu-rays, and more. Be sure to check GameSpot's Prime Day Deals hub for more.

Elden Ring's Official Hardcover Strategy Guides

  • Elden Ring Nightreign: Official Companion Guide -- $45 | Releases September 30
  • Elden Ring: The Lands Between - Books of Knowledge Volume 1 -- $50
  • Elden Ring: Shards of the Shattering - Books of Knowledge Volume 2 -- $50
  • Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree - Books of Knowledge Volume 3 -- $45

Elden Ring: The Road to the Erdtree Manga

  • Volume 1 -- $11.70 ($13)
  • Volume 2 -- $11.70 ($13)
  • Volume 3 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 4 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 5 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 6 -- $13 | Releases July 22
  • Volume 7 -- $13 | Releases October 28
